config.description: Analyze RBF matrix A computation cost

tuning_runs.result: FAILED - 200 simulations needed = 200 sec >> 9 sec budget
tuning_runs.notes: Each RBF collocation point requires one simulation to compute its column in matrix A.

tuning_runs.result: FAILED - Even coarsest 5x3=15 pts exceeds budget (15 sec vs 9 sec)
tuning_runs.notes: 5x3=15 pts: 15 sec (1.7x over), 10x5=50 pts: 50 sec (5.6x over), 20x10=200 pts: 200 sec (22x over)

config.description: Check if matrix A can be pre-computed

tuning_runs.result: FAILED - 100% unique sensor positions prevent pre-computation
tuning_runs.notes: 80 unique sensor configurations across 80 samples. Matrix A depends on sensor positions, so cannot be shared.

config.description: Compare to prior direct inversion attempts

tuning_runs.result: FAILED - Same fundamental issue as D-PBCS and Green's function
tuning_runs.notes: D-PBCS: 646x over budget. Green's function: 4.3x slower than ADI. All require building observation matrices.

finding: RBF meshless requires n_rbf_points simulations to build matrix A. Even coarsest grid (5Ã—3=15 pts = 15 sec) exceeds budget (9 sec) by 1.7x. 100% unique sensors prevent pre-computation. meshless_direct family EXHAUSTED.
